SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.LevelChallenge

Class Challenge

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
com.example.demo.Levels.LevelParent
com.example.demo.LevelChallenge.Challenge
public class Challenge extends LevelParent
The Challenge class represents a specific challenge level in the game. It extends from LevelParent and contains logic to handle the gameplay, enemy spawning, and checking for game over conditions.

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Challenge

      public Challenge(double screenHeight, double screenWidth, GameController controller)
      Constructor to initialize the Challenge level with the specified screen height, width, and game controller.
      Parameters:
      screenHeight - The height of the game screen.
      screenWidth - The width of the game screen.
      controller - The game controller to handle game events.

  • Method Details

    • checkIfGameOver

      protected void checkIfGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over. If the player is destroyed, the challenge is lost.
      Specified by:
      checkIfGameOver in class LevelParent

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      Initializes the friendly units (player) and the score display on the screen. Adds the user plane and score text to the root.
      Specified by:
      initializeFriendlyUnits in class LevelParent

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected void spawnEnemyUnits()
      Spawns enemy units based on a random probability. The number of enemies is limited by the constant TOTAL_ENEMIES. New enemies are spawned at a random Y position.
      Specified by:
      spawnEnemyUnits in class LevelParent

    • instantiateLevelView

      protected LevelView instantiateLevelView()
      Instantiates the LevelView for this level with the root and initial player health.
      Specified by:
      instantiateLevelView in class LevelParent
      Returns:
      The LevelView instance for this level.

    • userHasReachedKillTarget

      private boolean userHasReachedKillTarget()
      Checks if the player has reached the kill target required to advance to the next level.
      Returns:
      True if the player has killed enough enemies to advance, false otherwise.
